    "Implement From/Into traits for easier AST manipulation",

}

response:
{
  "filename": "src/environment.rs",
  "purpose": "Defines an abstraction layer for I/O operations with trait-based architecture, providing RealEnv for actual system operations and MockEnv for testing",
  "complexity": 5,
  "issues": [
    "HTTP error handling uses unwrap_or_default() which silently swallows errors and returns empty strings",
    "Shell command execution hardcoded to use 'sh -c' which may not work on all platforms (Windows)",
    "MockEnv HTTP methods reuse the files HashMap, creating confusing coupling between file system and HTTP mocking",
    "No timeout handling for HTTP requests which could hang indefinitely",
    "LlmRequest has untyped tools field using serde_json::Value instead of proper type",
    "Missing stderr capture in ShellResult struct",
    "No validation of file paths in read_file/write_file methods",
    "Tool calls in LlmResponse are untyped, making them difficult to work with safely"
  ],
  "suggestions": [
    "Replace unwrap_or_default() in HTTP methods with proper error propagation",
    "Add platform-specific shell detection or make shell command configurable",
    "Separate HTTP mocking from file mocking in MockEnv for clarity",
    "Add configurable timeouts for HTTP requests using reqwest client builder",
    "Create strongly-typed structs for tools and tool_calls instead of using serde_json::Value",
    "Add stderr field to ShellResult to capture command error output",
    "Add path validation and normalization in file operations",
    "Consider adding a Builder pattern for LlmRequest to ensure required fields are set",
    "Add logging for HTTP operations similar to file operations",
    "Consider making the trait async-compatible for better performance with I/O operations"
  ]
}

  "issues": [

    "Token import suggests tight coupling with lexer module",

    "Constructor methods have inconsistent naming (type_error vs parse/runtime)",
    "Display implementation doesn't show error kind, reducing debugging info"

  "suggestions": [

    "Add error codes enum for programmatic error handling",

    "Split unexpected_token function into smaller, categorized functions",
    "Add severity levels (warning, error, fatal) to error system",

  ]
}

content: === Project Summary ===
Files: 28

Architecture: Traditional language implementation stack with lexer->parser->AST->tree-walking interpreter pattern. Agentic programming language for deterministic control over AI-powered workflows with Python-like syntax and first-class LLM integration.
Score: 6/10
Top Issues:
• 44 expect() calls in parser cause panics instead of graceful error handling
• 25+ unwrap() calls in interpreter create reliability issues with LLM/network failures
• Platform compatibility issues - hardcoded 'sh -c' shell execution (Unix-only)
• Environment trait design flaw - call_llm() marked as should not be called but implemented poorly
• Type system incomplete - TypeDef exists but no runtime validation
• No internationalization support - all error messages hardcoded in English
Report saved to analysis-report.json
